ElementMouseleave_event.summary: The mouseleave event is fired at an when the cursor of a pointing device (usually a mouse) is moved out of it.

remarks.para: mouseleave and are similar but differ in that mouseleave does not bubble and mouseout does. This means that mouseleave is fired when the pointer has exited the element and all of its descendants, whereas mouseout is fired when the pointer leaves the element or leaves one of the element's descendants (even if the pointer is still within the element).
